org.apache.hive.spark.client

Interface SparkClient

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable

    @InterfaceAudience.Private
public interface SparkClient
extends Serializable
    Defines the API for the Spark remote client.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • submit

        <T extends Serializable> JobHandle<T> submit(Job<T> job)
        Submits a job for asynchronous execution.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A handle that be used to monitor the job.

      • submit

                                             List<JobHandle.Listener<T>> listeners)
        Submits a job for asynchronous execution.
        Parameters:
        job - The job to execute.
        listeners - jobhandle listeners to invoke during the job processing
        Returns:
        A handle that be used to monitor the job.

      • run

        <T extends Serializable> Future<T> run(Job<T> job)
        Asks the remote context to run a job immediately.

        Normally, the remote context will queue jobs and execute them based on how many worker threads have been configured. This method will run the submitted job in the same thread processing the RPC message, so that queueing does not apply.

        It's recommended that this method only be used to run code that finishes quickly. This avoids interfering with the normal operation of the context.

        Note: the JobContext#monitor() functionality is not available when using this method.
        Parameters:
        job - The job to execute.
        Returns:
        A future to monitor the result of the job.

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stops the remote context. Any pending jobs will be cancelled, and the remote context will be torn down.

      • addJar

        Future<?> addJar(URI uri)
        Adds a jar file to the running remote context. Note that the URL should be reachable by the Spark driver process. If running the driver in cluster mode, it may reside on a different host, meaning "file:" URLs have to exist on that node (and not on the client machine).
        Parameters:
        uri - The location of the jar file.
        Returns:
        A future that can be used to monitor the operation.

      • addFile

        Future<?> addFile(URI uri)
        Adds a file to the running remote context. Note that the URL should be reachable by the Spark driver process. If running the driver in cluster mode, it may reside on a different host, meaning "file:" URLs have to exist on that node (and not on the client machine).
        Parameters:
        uri - The location of the file.
        Returns:
        A future that can be used to monitor the operation.

      • getExecutorCount

        Future<Integer> getExecutorCount()
        Get the count of executors.

      • getDefaultParallelism

        Future<Integer> getDefaultParallelism()
        Get default parallelism. For standalone mode, this can be used to get total number of cores.

      • isActive

        boolean isActive()
        Check if remote context is still active.
